III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention Standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth is being verbally abused by staff members.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Youth A said Staff 1 is “disrespectful and unprofessional”
towards the youth. Youth A said Staff 1 will intentionally provoke
the youth to become upset by threatening to write fake incident
reports about them, noting it is only for certain youth that he does
not like. Youth A said Staff 1 will allow other youth to antagonize
her and then laughs when she becomes upset. Youth A said there
was an incident when she was upset and Staff 1 said to her “when
other youth leave people get an S on their chest”, stating it meant
something about being more disrespectful. Youth A said she
responded by telling Staff 1 he would not dare to say these types
of things to a grown man because he would “get his in his shit”.
Youth A said Staff 1 responded with a comment about her getting
hit again since a peer had punch her a few months ago during an
altercation. Youth A said she was yelling at Staff 1 and Supervisor
Y came onto the unit and was redirecting her for calling Staff 1 a
“bitch” but was not saying anything to Staff 1 about what he had
said to her. Youth A said Staff 3 was on the unit during this incident
as well as the other youth. Youth A denied Staff 1 ever threatening
to be physically aggressive towards her. Youth A denied Staff 1
ever physically touching her in any way.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Youth B said Staff 1 is a “good staff” who checks in with the
youth to make sure they are all doing good each time he works.
Youth B said she has never seen Staff 1 yell at any youth and only
redirects youth when they are doing something they are not
supposed to. Youth B said Staff 1 intervened in a fight last night
between her and Youth A in order to protect her from Youth A.
Youth B said Youth A is a “bully” and will call staff and youth
names and try to start arguments with them. Youth B said Youth A
is very disrespectful towards Staff 1 and will call him names, cuss
at him, and yell at him while Staff 1 does not engage. Youth B said
she has no concerns regarding Staff 1’s interaction with her or any
other youth.
2

Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Youth C said Staff 1 is “very chill” as a staff member and will
just encourage youth to work the program and do what is right.
Youth C said Staff 1 does not provoke or antagonize youth. Youth
C said Staff 1 does not yell at youth or ever disrespect them.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on April 29, 2025. Staff 1
said he is a second shift staff that works at Vassar House. Staff 1
said Youth A tends to avoid him as he is a seasoned employee
and holds all the youth accountable to the program expectations
and she does not like that. Staff 1 said Youth A used to be quiet
and would follow expectations without issue however since the
discharge of several other youth she has become disrespectful,
argumentative, and refuses to follow many expectations of the
program. Staff 1 said Youth A will ask for things she knows she
cannot do or have and then become angry when told no. Staff 1
said Youth A’s mood towards staff shifts depending on if she gets
her way for the day. Staff 1 said Youth A is not only disrespectful
towards staff, but she also yells and curses at her peers which has
created a tense environment at times between youth. Staff 1 said
he has never shown favoritism towards any youth and hold them
all to the same standards and rules. Staff 1 said he has never
cursed at Youth A and has never heard any other staff curse at her
either. Staff 1 denied antagonizing Youth A or seeing any other
staff antagonize her. Staff 1 denied calling Youth A names or
verbally or emotionally abusing her in any way.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Staff 2 said she does not work any shifts with Staff 1. Staff 2
said Youth A has never disclosed to her that Staff 1 was verbally or
emotionally abusing her. Staff 2 said Youth A has made comments
about “hating” Staff 1 however never gave reasons why. Staff 2
said none of the other youth have voiced any complaints or
concerns about Staff 1 to her.
Staff 3 was interviewed via telephone on April 24, 2025. Staff 3
said she worked many shifts with Staff 1 while employed at the
facility. Staff 3 said she has never seen or heard Staff 1 be
verbally or emotionally abusive towards Youth A or any other
youth. Staff 3 said Youth A would ask Staff 1 for something she
knew she was not allowed to have and when he told her no, she
would become argumentative and yell at him. Staff 3 said Staff 1
always treated all the youth the same and never threatened or
was disrespectful towards Youth A.
3

Supervisor Z was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
April 8, 2025. Supervisor Z said she has not seen or heard Staff 1
yelling or cursing at Youth A or any other youth. Supervisor Z said
Youth A will put herself in the middle of things lately which causes
staff to have to redirect her behavior and she then becomes upset
and argumentative. Supervisor Z said Youth A has told her that
she wishes Staff 1 would “die” and that she “hates” him.
Supervisor Z said Youth A seems to focus a lot of her anger on
Staff 1 and does not act in the same manner towards other staff
members.
Supervisor Y was interviewed via telephone on April 24, 2025.
Supervisor Y said he is the primary supervisor for second shift and
has worked with Staff 1 frequently. Supervisor Y said he has never
seen or heard of Staff 1 using derogatory or disrespectful
language with Youth A or any other youth. Supervisor Y said he
has never seen or heard Staff 1 threaten Youth A or any other
youth or use their past against them in conversation. Supervisor Y
said Youth A has changed her behaviors drastically over the past
few months and will argue with staff over most anything, is
verbally aggressive with youth and staff, and has an overall bad
attitude most days. Supervisor Y said he has never had concerns
with Staff 1’s interactions with Youth A or any other youth, treating
all youth the same.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was discipline on November
7, 2022, for a medication error; July 9, 2024, for not
ensuring the units were following a schedule; July 10, 2024,
for not conducting supervisor rounds; December 11, 2024,
for using his personal cell phone at work; January 27, 2025,
for engaging in inappropriate conversations regarding
social media and crimes with youth; March 25, 2025, for
eating outside food in front of the youth which is against
policy. Staff 1 participated in training that covered all
prohibited practices including “Verbal abuse, ridicule,
humiliation, or threat” on February 24, 2024.
• Wolverine Human Services Communication with Recipients
of Care (Clients) Policy was reviewed. The policy clearly
outlines “All staff are expected to communicate with
recipients of care (clients) in a professional manner.
Communication not authorized by the Agency will be
interpreted as unprofessional, sexual, predatory, and/or
illegal. Specifically, staff should not swear at, threaten, or
communicate in any way that would violate Child Protection
Law.”
4

Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews Youth A is not being verbally abused by Staff 1 or any
other staff member.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
